intro: Plesmonium margaritiferum, commonly known as the yellow sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its yellow flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Plesmonium margaritiferum is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
